column1: What are the five pillars of the AWS Well-Architected Framework?
column2: Operational Excellence, Security, Reliability, Performance Efficiency, Cost Optimization

column1: What is the purpose of the Operational Excellence pillar in AWS Well-Architected Framework?
column2: To run and monitor systems to deliver business value and to continually improve supporting processes and procedures.

column1: What does the Security pillar focus on in AWS Well-Architected Framework?
column2: Protecting information, systems, and assets while delivering business value through risk assessments and mitigation strategies.

column1: How does the Reliability pillar define its goal within AWS Well-Architected Framework?
column2: Ensuring a workload performs its intended function correctly and consistently when it's expected to, including the ability to operate and test recovery procedures.

column1: What is the aim of Performance Efficiency in AWS Well-Architected Framework?
column2: Using compute resources efficiently to meet system requirements and to maintain efficiency as demand changes and technologies evolve.

column1: What is the purpose of the Cost Optimization pillar in the AWS Well-Architected Framework?
column2: To avoid or eliminate unneeded costs or suboptimal resources.
